subject: Re: Overriding AssertEquals
msgSnippet: ... Lavangu, You may have long ago, stopped reading this thread, but just in case... So, no, you can t override AssertEquals . What you can do is:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "lavangu" <lavangu@y...> wrote:
> Is there any way i can override AssertEquals?
> My intention is to compare 2 Arraylists for similarity of its
> contents.

Lavangu,

You may have long ago, stopped reading this thread, but just in case...

So, "no, you can't override AssertEquals". What you can do is:
assertTrue(isSimilar(a, b));
for two ArrayLists a and b. Write your own isSimilar, depending on
whether you mean:
/1/ a and b have the same number of elements, and are element by
element equal.
/2/ a and b have the same elements, and the same number of each
element, but they might be out of order
/3/ a and b are composed of the same constituent elements, but they
might be out of order, and we're not concerned with duplications.

Eric




public void testAssumption2() {
ArrayList x = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"a", "b", "a"}));
ArrayList x2 = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"a", "b",
"a"}));
ArrayList y = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"a", "a", "b"}));
ArrayList z = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(new String[] {"b", "a", "b"}));

assertEquals(true, isSimilar1(x, x2));
assertEquals(false, isSimilar1(x, y));
assertEquals(false, isSimilar1(x, z));

assertEquals(true, isSimilar2(x, x2));
assertEquals(true, isSimilar2(x, y));
assertEquals(false, isSimilar2(x, z));

assertEquals(true, isSimilar3(x, x2));
assertEquals(true, isSimilar3(x, y));
assertEquals(true, isSimilar3(x, z));
}

private boolean isSimilar1(ArrayList a, ArrayList b) {
return a.equals(b);
}

private boolean isSimilar2(ArrayList a, ArrayList b) {
ArrayList tmp = new ArrayList(a);
for (int i=0; i<b.size(); ++i) {
if (!tmp.remove(b.get(i))) {
return false;
}
}
return tmp.isEmpty();
}

private boolean isSimilar3(ArrayList a, ArrayList b) {
return new HashSet(a).equals(new HashSet(b));
}
